name: stereoscopic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to refer to films or pictures that are filmed or shown using a special piece of equipment that creates an image that looks solid and real: He studied stereoscopic aerial photographs of the glacier. He makes stereoscopic images that lurch into three dimensions when we look at them with the aid of a small viewing apparatus.
More examplesFewer examplesThe camera team plans to capture stereoscopic images of Titan's surface.The lenses send different images to the viewers' left and right eyes, mimicking our stereoscopic view of the real world. Two-eyed stereoscopic viewers pop microscopic beasties into three dimensions.
